title: Powerful Tractor Plowing the Field | Farming in Action  #Tractor #TractorPlowing #PlowingTheField

tasks.task: Operate farm equipment leading to oxen movement
subtasks: Feed the oxen before plowing
Attach the plow to the front of the tractor
Guide the oxen to move and plow the field
Operate the tractor's plowing mechanism
Stop the plowing when the field is adequately tilled
Prepare for the next round of plowing by detaching the plow

tasks.task: Perform oxen husbandry skills for plowing preparations
subtasks: Walk alongside the plowing path to prompt oxen movements
Use a goad or similar tool to encourage oxen
Ensure oxen are moving in the correct direction
Manage oxen's speed during plowing

tasks.task: Drive tractor for field operations
subtasks: Secure the plow onto the tractor's hitch
Start the tractor and drive it to the field
Maneuver the tractor to align with the plowing lines
Control the tractor's power and steering during plow operation

tasks.task: Tend to the plowing process
subtasks: Monitor the plowing depth and adjust plow settings if necessary
Check for stones or debris that might damage the plow or impede progress
Keep an eye on oxen's well-being during the work

tasks.task: Unload and adjust the plow for different field conditions
subtasks: Disengage the plow from the tractor
Inspect the plow blades for wear and adjust as needed
Reposition the plow to suit varying field terrains

tasks.task: Communicate with the plowman during the process
subtasks: Give directions to the plowman regarding field boundaries
Confirm the plowed area meets the desired size and shape

tasks.task: Prepare for harvesting by plowing
subtasks: Evaluate the soil's condition after plowing
Make notes or mark sections requiring further attention
Plan the next steps, such as sowing or planting

tasks.task: Monitor the plowing team
subtasks: Oversee the plowing operation to ensure efficiency
Address any issues that arise during plowing

tasks.task: Conduct safety checks on the tractor and plow before use
subtasks: Inspect all moving parts, lubrication points, and safety features
Perform routine maintenance tasks as needed

tasks.task: Harvest the previous year's crops using the same fields
subtasks: Confirm the fields are ready for harvest through plowing
Adjust the plow depth to aid in turning over crop residue
Begin harvesting by operating the plow to collect mature crops

tasks.task: Inspect the plowed soil for proper cultivation
subtasks: Assess the soil's texture and structure
Check for any clumps or uneven areas that need further work
Note areas where the plow did not penetrate sufficiently
Make a plan for secondary plowing if needed

tasks.task: Use natural methods (oxen) for plowing
subtasks: Acclimate oxen to the plowing process over time
Train oxen in following the plow
Ensure oxen are sufficiently rested and hydrated

tasks.task: Handle plow maintenance tasks
subtasks: Disassemble the plow for cleaning and inspection
Sharpen or replace worn plow blades
Apply oil or grease to moving parts

tasks.task: Carry out day-to-day farm management related to plowing
subtasks: Prepare the necessary plowing schedule
Plan the rotation of crops and fields
Allocate appropriate labor and resources for plowing
